intro: Trigonella rhytidocarpa f. glabra, commonly known as the smooth-flowered fenugreek, is a variant of the fenugreek plant native to arid and semi-arid regions. It is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has smooth, hairless stems and leaves, distinguishing it from other forms of Trigonella. It is adapted to survive in harsh environments with low water availability. This variety is valued for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional herbal remedies.
